website_summaries.verdict: Not a complete rock tumbling kit – grit and stones not included – but a sturdy platform for many polishing and cleaning projects.
pros: Works well with stones, glass, jewelry, and ammo casings
cons: Can run hot, so location is critical
Not recommended for heavy duty purposes
Advanced users may want the twin barrel model

customer_reviews.title: A little workhorse!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with anything like this. My tumbler has now been running for a week and I changed to stage two today. I could not believe the difference in the rocks already! So easy to use, sturdy, and great instructions. I’m very happy. Can’t wait to see the end results. UPDATE: Just finished my first set of four grit/ polishing stages (took a month) and I could not be happier with the results. The rocks are gorgeous. On the left: the type of rocks I started with. On the right: finished product. Everyone loves them. They’re so smooth and shiny.
customer_reviews.author: jenpnc

customer_reviews.title: Too hot to handle
customer_reviews.text: I started using this tumbler about an hour ago. In that time the motor generated so much heat that the glue holding on the rubber feet melted off. The manual does claim that a hot motor is normal, but it doesn't say how hot is normal. I'm pretty sure it shouldn't get so hot that it destroys itself. I also would believe this much heat generation means it's terribly power inefficient.
customer_reviews.author: RYAN K POWERS

customer_reviews.title: It's running like a champ!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in process of polishing my first batch and my Lortone is running like a champ. Can't wait to see how my rocks turn out in the final stage. When I was a youngster, I had a tumbler and was fascinated with how plain rocks could look so beautiful once tumbled and polished. Now I'm an oldster and just as fascinated with the tumbling process. Each machine may encounter some problems, but so far mine seems to be doing it's job very well. Did I mention the Lortone is made in the USA?
customer_reviews.author: Susan F

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: Love my tumbler, use it for jewelry, mostly copper. It work hardens my pieces as well as smooths out any rough edges and cleans it to a high polish.
customer_reviews.author: Mary 😊

customer_reviews.title: I really like the lid style of this tumbler
customer_reviews.text: The tumbler I received quit working within 4 days, but Amazon helped me return & reorder and the replacement has been working non-stop tumbling glass for about a month without any issues. I really like the lid style of this tumbler. Other tumblers I have require a lot of hand strength and prying off of lids but the thumb screw style of this barrel lid means it's very easy to get the lid on and off without tools, and it's never leaked so much as a single drop of water.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn B

customer_reviews.title: Follow the directions and be patient. You'll be happy with the results.
customer_reviews.text: Packaging was fine. No issues. Opened it up with the tumble kit I bought, picked the rocks (all agate found on So California beach) followed the instructions and photo of the first batch. I don't think the photos do the rocks justice. They came out beautiful. Did 7 days for each grit and 10 days for the final polish. Second batch is in. The tumbler has been on 7/24 for over 6 weeks. No belt problems and no leaks. Electric motors runs hot as expected. So I put a fan next to it and it stays cool. May not need it but makes me feel better. It's in the garage and it's not noisy. Now I want a bigger one!
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: This is an AWFUL product.
customer_reviews.text: This Product was such a disappointment. My grandson was so excited to tumble his rocks and the belt kept jumping off. My husband had to repair it four times, and then we decided to return it. We bought one from National Geographics for half the cost and it is working beautifully and came with everything you need to make some jewellery from your rocks. Do not waste your time or money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Allison Morris

customer_reviews.title: Best small tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made machine. It is a little tricky to get the lid off and on, but I like the simplicity of hard rubber barrel and top. Simple to maintain and clean. I believe it will last outlast cheaper tumblers so many times, that it is cost effective to buy Lortone. Even if something breaks, they have parts! It can be fixed instead of throwing it away. Tumbling jewelry is quiet enough that you can do it in the house. If you are tumbling rocks for days (and days and days...), you probably want to put it in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: ALF

customer_reviews.title: Works really well, runs pretty quietly!
customer_reviews.text: So far, my husband and 4 year old are fascinated! Our four year old LOVES rocks, and she and her dad have been checking progress everyother day. Operationally, the sound level is similar to the dishwasher, thought that may be due to the types of rocks (also purchased on Amazon), and it's been running in our kitchen for a week now without causing headaches or annoyance!
customer_reviews.author: KarenS

customer_reviews.title: Buy elsewhere.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this off amazon. I own another that I love I got from a trusted ewlery supply store. The one from amazon was a “return” but sighting cheaper. It arrived, didn’t work. But I know tumblers so I fixed it. It’s working. However. I’m not sure if this is a legitimate Lortone. The cord is different then the one I bought from Rio grande ( very trusted ) and it feels like a crappy cord. Photo. Left is amazon. Right is trusted jewelry supply store.
customer_reviews.author: Foxandthefawn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for polishing metal
customer_reviews.text: I alive this tumbler EXCEPT that there is no off or on button. To turn it off you just grab the cord and yank, kind of annoying. Otherwise, this works perfectly. I have about 2.5 pounds of stainless steel shot in it for grinding.
customer_reviews.author: RHIANNA

customer_reviews.title: I could not be more pleased with this product
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more pleased with this product. I had no idea what to buy, so I took a chance. I am glad I did. I just finished the first week of tumbling rocks and they are already smooth, shiny and beautiful. If I ever need another tumbler, I will buy the same maker only a bigger size. It really does not make much noise either.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Too hot for my taste
customer_reviews.text: It runs too hot for my comfort level. You can almost not touch it because it runs so hot. I placed it on a tile to prevent fire. Will not let it run overnight for tumbling rocks because I am concerned. Probably going to send back for something more heavy duty and safer.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Drennan

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable
customer_reviews.text: This only worked right for 1 month, now it doesn’t spin the rock container any more. I was careful, weighed rocks as to not overload it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Devers

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. No louder than expected. I can see that leakage could be a problem if you are not careful, because the nut that you tighten to seal the drum is actually pulling the lid away from the drum and could break the seal if over tightened.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Gouge

customer_reviews.title: Effective Jewelry Polisher
customer_reviews.text: This is the fourth Lortone Tumbler I have purchased and used in the last 7 years. I have a larger one also. I depend on these tumblers for most of my jewelry polishing in my Etsy shop. I can't imagine doing without them. They are work horses--dependable and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: FusedNTwisted

customer_reviews.title: I loved it for the 24 hours that it worked.
customer_reviews.text: I really want a nice rock tumbler and I hoped that this was it. After a bit over 24 hours I check the tumbler and, though the motor was running the barrel was not spinning. I am very disappointed and find myself shopping for a new tumbler.
customer_reviews.author: A Loyal Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: How to choose the right thing for you
customer_reviews.text: I'm quite new to tumbling stones, so I've thought about an affordable device, but, at the same time, of good quality. That's really hard, because almost always we think that cheap might mean low quality. After a couple of weeks of searching the web I learned enough about the tumbling devices to know that (for me at least) the Lortone 3A was the right choice. And I wasn't wrong. It works great and till now I've got no complains. The rpm is a bit slower than designed because in my country we have 50Hz current, but I let it roll one day more on each step, so the stones came out fine. Nice hobby and great machine!
customer_reviews.author: Petru Kovacs

customer_reviews.title: I love this so much
customer_reviews.text: I love this so much, I got it in conjunction with the national geographic 4 piece grit set and have been working on some rocks I got in NC for my birthday I got in August. I sort of wish I'd sprung for the double barreled though, because I am having to run each step twice in order to have enough rocks for the next stage. I am also now looking into getting the plastic bits for polish phase, though might just cut up a pool noodle or something similiar.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Great item for polishing jewelry!
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this a few days but I love it!! Easy to use. Put steel shot in it and now all my silver and gold stuff is sparkling. I also make jewelry on the side so it is perfect for the few things I make. If you are a professional jewelry maker and make lots of stuff, this might be too small but for the rest of us, it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS TUMBLER
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS TUMBLER! I use it to polish jewelry Ive made and it works wonders! Its pretty quiet and even the sound it does make is like have a nice little white noise machine in my room. Best money I have spent in forever
customer_reviews.author: Tania

customer_reviews.title: First Rate Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: My dad is a treasure hunter (he metal detects) and he wore out his previous Lorton Barrel Tumber (after 20+ years). This is a very high quality product and worth the price. He is very happy with this his new tumbler - and my dad is a tough crowd. I have seen the coins and other items come out after they have been cleaned and they looks awesome. This little guy does a fine job.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: great entry level barrel tumbler
customer_reviews.text: great entry level barrel tumbler. Quiet, no vibration in driveline. Gets warm but still safe to leave for continuous operation. I give it some air gap underneath, for better cooling. The only drawback I encountered is some difficulty to open drum. Recommended in manual procedure did not work for me.
customer_reviews.author: SERGEI RUSAKOV

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this. I think that it is a great product, but I am having trouble with mine and I am forced to give a low rating because I don't know how to get in touch with the seller. Our rotors won't spin. We had a leaky barrel and it spilled cement all over the place. The sellers were able to send us a new barrel, but now the rotors won't spin the barrel and I can't find a way to get a hold of the sellers again. I can't find warranty information on this site, so I don't know what to do. I really want to like this product, but it just won't work!
customer_reviews.author: dana thomas

customer_reviews.title: Should last more than 3 months!
customer_reviews.text: I loved it while it worked only lasted 3 months
customer_reviews.author: Debbie A

customer_reviews.title: Barrel seems like it's very sturdy and will last a long time
customer_reviews.text: 25 days in use so far. Works as advertised, no complaints. As noted in other reviews, it makes some noise, so it's in the garage. Lot quieter after we added some plastic beads in cycle 3 & 4. Lid locks down tight, no leaks. Barrel seems like it's very sturdy and will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Nice solid little tumbler!!
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it once since I got it last week, but I am SO impressed. I owned the red one (another brand) and it squeaked and squealed and didn't run properly from the start, but this is amazing! I will come back later if I have issues with it, but I am very impressed so far!!
customer_reviews.author: tboombi

customer_reviews.title: Great investment and product
customer_reviews.text: The best tumbler on the market, for the price. A must for any silversmith. Really worth every penny. Great investment in your time and your business, If you want that high polish you will get it with this product. Just read directions, use it right and take good care of it for long lasting use
customer_reviews.author: Annie0135

customer_reviews.title: It does a nice job also
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in August and it's been running non-stop since then. It is now 5 months later. The first few days the belt popped off a few times, but I just put it back on and soon it never did that again. I still have the extra belt it came with. And it is not as loud as the other cheaper models. It does a nice job also. I am pleased with what I have found within my rocks. Just follow the directions and don't be in a hurry. It's a slow process.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Beardsley

customer_reviews.title: This is my now, go to machine!
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good, durable, and reliable machine for quite some time. (I also recently purchased one from another company, and it was a HUGE disaster.) This is what I got as a small replacement till I can upgrade again. I will, from now on rely on Lortone rotary tumblers. (I don't want to forget to mention how QUIET this machine is compared to any other on the market.) Its been worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda G.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working shortly after return window closed. No response from seller to resolve issue.
customer_reviews.text: Tumbler worked as expected for less than 3 months; then stopped and will not power on. Contacted seller. Seller did not respond. Disappointed - will check warranty in future.
customer_reviews.author: clm

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered except ....
customer_reviews.text: Runs quiet. Reliable so far(running continuously for several weeks now). One complaint - the aluminum frame/body material is so thin, it barely holds the sheet metal screws in place. Care must be taken not to bend the frame when the top cover is off. A slightly thicker metal would have made a much better product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: OK to take a Fun Tumble with This One!
customer_reviews.text: Used this for tumbling stones. Wish it had an on/off switch, visual power indicator, and a timer only after using the tumbler for a little while. The machine is a good performer for the price paid. Read up a bit because knowing what you are doing will produce a far better outcome. Follow the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: John Murray

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: It's not that it is a bad product. It seems well made and easy to use. It's that it gets so hot I don't trust running it when we're not home or out in a garage where I can't monitor it so I can unplug it when it gets to hot. Can't really run it long enough at a time to get a rock job done.
customer_reviews.author: Corie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is a little weird to open and close but it seals just fine. It works well, no leaks. We run it for 30 to 60 Minutes at a time to clean silver jewelry with the tiny stainless fragments product.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for my wife for Christmas. She just finished the first tumble and the rocks look great. This unit works smoothly and seems to be really well made. I’m glad I spent the extra money on this as opposed to one of the cheaper hobby models. My only regret is that I didn’t buy one with a larger capacity barrel as my already has a bucket full of new rocks to tumble.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: The first tumbler I've ever had and it's great. It came on time and packaged well
customer_reviews.text: The first tumbler I've ever had and it's great. It came on time and packaged well. I use it for cleaning already made pieces of jewelry, pieces that I've repaired and pieces that I design as well as cleaning my own jump rings and other findings that I make. I use this tumbler with stainless steel shot. I'm going to get another for polishing stones and recycled glass for use in my jewelry designs.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri Watson

customer_reviews.title: Commercial grade tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Well made. Motor gets very hot because it runs for days. I bought a usb 2 fan electronics cooling unit, from ac infinity. Same one I use for our Xbox . Works great. Unit does not look like a toy.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas K.

customer_reviews.title: 1 month life?
customer_reviews.text: Hello. I only give low marks on some reviews because i am having issues. I purchased my Lortone 3a 3/14/19 and began using it the 2nd week in April. Lovely results to start. Now inconsistent speed of barrel. Freezing of barrel. Hot motor. Sometimes results are black instead of shiny....which means running several times to clean. Using the burnishing liquid recommended. Stainless steel shot, just a few pieces at a time as I am not producing mass quantities. Sad at this. I keep everything clean and followed directions.
customer_reviews.author: Donna wittosch

customer_reviews.title: If I could give this tumbler 100 stars I would!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m new to rockhounding and rock tumbling and had seen many people that have been doing this for a long time using this rock tumbler and saying it’s the best you can buy for its durability, ease of use, low noise and longevity. I’ve had this tumbler a week so far and have not had the first issue and don’t for see any. If all goes well (I’m sure it will) I will be buying more of these in the future so I can have rocks tumbling at different stages. If I could give this tumbler 100 stars I would!!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda Welch

customer_reviews.title: Tumbler Review
customer_reviews.text: I make sterling silver jewelry and purchased this to burnish completed pieces with two pounds of steel shot. The tumbler is easy to use with ample space for my needs. It's water tight - I have yet to notice any leaks - and is also quiet enough that I can hear the steel shot rolling around inside more than I can hear the motor. Required maintenance seems pretty straightforward based on the instructions included in the box. It's performed perfectly so far, but I've only used it about five times. I haven't had it long enough to comment on durability, but based on what I've seen I would definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Great tumbler for jewelry making
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this tumbler. I use it for jewelry. I'm so glad I bought it! Quality machine!
customer_reviews.author: sr9

customer_reviews.title: I was a big fan until it died after four months.
customer_reviews.text: I was really impressed with how well this rock tumbler worked. The rocks I put in it transformed into some beautiful specimens. Unfortunately, after 3 months of use, it quit working. I'm so disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Landis

customer_reviews.title: Really like this. Previous experience was with a plastic "toy" ...
customer_reviews.text: Really like this. Previous experience was with a plastic "toy" model, what a piece of junk! This unit has been pleasantly surprising. Quietish, no problems, just ordered all the junk to go with it (rocks, grit, pellets, strainer) so for me it was "plug and play".
customer_reviews.author: richard j. case

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter for Christmas. Exceeded expectations! Very durable and hasn’t skipped a beat. I was able to achieve the glassy polished look using the Polly Plastics 4-stage set of grit. Daughter is ecstatic!
customer_reviews.author: Dsquared

customer_reviews.title: Like this tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Like this tumbler. I ordered a cheaper one a few months back because I wasn't sure if I wanted to make that investment. When I decided to upgrade this seemed like the one for me based on the reviews. It's not loud and does the job just fine. It was hard as heck getting the top off at first but again determination got me through!
customer_reviews.author: Thelma M. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Good little unit.
customer_reviews.text: After running this unit (3lb tumbler) all summer, and most of the fall, I am very happy with this little unit. Not overly loud because of the all rubber drum. The only improve I could see that would be a huge benefit, would be the addition of an inline on/off switch built in. other than that, good little product, considering a larger one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Lee M.

customer_reviews.title: Great tumbler, American made, so fun I should have bought the double barrel model!
customer_reviews.text: Well built, quiet and American made. Work as described, the rubber barrel keeps the noise down. I keep mine in my shop, but it could be in the laundry room too. I should have bought the double barrel model because my wife and grandkids developed an interest after I tumbled my first batch!
customer_reviews.author: mike j

customer_reviews.title: Barrel Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine it works great! I gave it a 4 because it seems to get really hot after a few hours of running. I don’t let it run over night because it gets hot to touch so it takes me longer to make glass.
customer_reviews.author: Read,Read,Read

customer_reviews.title: I loved this when I was a kid
customer_reviews.text: I loved this when I was a kid, and it's so much fun for my niece and nephew now. It's still the same, high-quality if was all those years ago, which I was thankful for. The motor is not too loud, but you can hear it churning away so placing it in a back room or garage might be best if you don't want to hear it.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa Watt

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: It's a true MACHINE. runs constantly for months at a time. Quiet, for a rock tumbler. Easy set up. Easy clean. I find my stones, shape them, sometimes, then into this wonder machine they go for 1 to 1 1/2 months (orange banded agate, hard). Will post pixs when this run is done. B4 and after. Az desert rocks rule!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sheton

customer_reviews.title: Great while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tumbler so me and my kids would have a new project while locked up during the pandemic. It worked flawlessly until we made it to the polish phase and then broke. I was provided with a full refund and got one nearly-finished batch of rocks out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Cam

customer_reviews.title: Great silversmithing polisher
customer_reviews.text: Great for polishing my silver jewelry in making! Affordable silversmithing polisher. Get stainless steel shot for it - 2 lb is plenty.
customer_reviews.author: Elena M.

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised. This thing seems built to last ...
customer_reviews.text: Just as advertised. This thing seems built to last. Be careful if you are using anything that suds. Pressure can open the canister. I use mine to clean my coins from metal detecting.
customer_reviews.author: S.H.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I received this an anniversary gift on October 10th. I was performing the second round of gritting and the entire machine imploded. The motor appears to be burned out and there is gray ooze everywhere. I’m extremely disappointed. We didn’t even finish one set of ricks before this fairly expensive tumbler imploded
customer_reviews.author: H. Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Rock Tumbler is very quite
customer_reviews.text: Very quite, only on my third week so I don't have much to say so far. I should have purchased the double barrel tumbler. If the tumbler last long time, I will purchase the double barrel next time
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Lortone 3a Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful little tumbler! I use it for jewelry polishing and hardening. It is well made, no leaks from the drum which is good but the lid is a little tight in the beginning to take off. The motor is fairly quiet. I have it sitting on a rubber mat and the sound does not transfer to other rooms in the house. Very pleased with this made in the U.S. product.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Gilchrist

customer_reviews.title: Prompt
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it one day and it arrived the next--in great condition. I am tumbling my first batch of rocks right now. I have a similar one from Lortone that I bought several years ago and it still works.
customer_reviews.author: Fay

customer_reviews.title: Lortone tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Not really a kit. Doesn't come with abrasives. Had to buy the grit separately as well as plastic pellets which I advise spending the 8 bucks for a box of them for Stage 4 or even Stage 3. Rock volume does drop from having outsides scoured off, so you want to use the pellets to make up the difference in volume as well as quiet the load tumbling. This tumbler is quiet, but it does make noise no worse than a mild, white background noise. Has been running 5 weeks straight now and no problems whatsoever. Thinking about buying the two-barrel model. Love it. .
customer_reviews.author: crushednotbroken

customer_reviews.title: Best little tumbler out there!
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is fantastic!! This is the best way to polish and finish jewelry. I leave it going for hours at a time and I get a fantastic finish on my silver and bronze jewelry. It gets a little hot, but I haven't noticed any issues with this.
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Braun

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value for your money
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter simply loves this Christmas present she is a rock hound excellent quality and value it's been 5 months already and still going strong
customer_reviews.author: guy jacobsen

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my girlfriend, she loves it! Heard some bad reviews about it but only because of the belt tension problems. We have not had this problem. We are getting great results from this tumbler. Did not receive extra belt like advertised. Will contact business about this and hope to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: Beaner

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that to be careful of is that what I read prior said that it only takes 3 or 4 days to polish. It's actually 4 steps of 10 days each. It's long............if you're in a hurry, rock polishing isn't for you. However, with that said, this unit works fabulously. It's relatively quiet and it doesn't jump around like many units do. I haven't had any issues with leakage or heat from the unit either. I'm impressed so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lortone 3A Single Barrel Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: This tumbler is average quality and the main problem is that the barrel cover is touching the rod below so it creats some metal dust. This is quite basic system for a high price but it works well and the cases are clean even after less than one hour with stainlesssteel pins and a spoon of citric acid and dishsoap drops. I hope it will last that is why it bought this bran specialized in tumbler.
customer_reviews.author: Nono

customer_reviews.title: ... and shine my silver jewelry pieces and am very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: I use this tumbler to burnish and shine my silver jewelry pieces and am very happy with it. It is so much quieter than my last tumbler!
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this running for weeks on end, and it looks like new. seems indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Jones

customer_reviews.title: Seems good so far
customer_reviews.text: It seems pretty durable. It has been running nonstop for weeks, so far with no trouble. The capacity was about what I expected, so I have no complaints there. It gets a little warm when running, nothing to be concerned about, though. And the rubberized drum makes it fairly quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim in California

customer_reviews.title: Still amazing to see the form
customer_reviews.text: It works but is a very long process for one batch of rocks. 1 month and they still didn't come to a shine. Probably need to repeat one of the steps. Still amazing to see the form, texture and color changes.
customer_reviews.author: Lgermain

customer_reviews.title: It does the job!!
customer_reviews.text: It gets warm so don’t touch it while it’s running. It’s also pretty quiet in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Jellybelly

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: I've been running it constantly for over two months now. No troubles, holds a good temperature, and hasn't tossed a belt. Best quality tumbler I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin O'Connor

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 9 yo present in Christmas. I was afraid of the noise it might produce but I was pleasantly surprised how quiet it is. I couldn't deal with the noise in the same room as me all day but we have a closet with an outlet. It is plugged in there with the closet door closed and I hardly hear it in the next room unless i make a point to stop and listen.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is absolutely amazing. Makes all the difference when you do jewelry and leaves your pieces shining. I use it with Shinebrite compound and Riogrande jewelry cleaner. Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Joana

customer_reviews.title: An excellent tumbler!
customer_reviews.text: Has been in almost non-stop use for the past year. Had to replace the belt once, but it was easy to do.
customer_reviews.author: huffakl

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a jewelry tumbler
customer_reviews.text: I love this wet tumbler! It does get a bit warm even being run for just a hour but I've had it a while now and haven't had any major issues other then the overheating issue.
customer_reviews.author: Denise D.

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have purchased sooner!
customer_reviews.text: I have never used a tumbler with my jewelry and cannot believe it took me this long to purchase one! This is the perfect size for my discs and it makes my jewelry so much cleaner than just hand polishing. I wish I would have purchased this sooner!!
customer_reviews.author: Josiah

customer_reviews.title: Better than the average tumbler.
customer_reviews.text: Very good tumbler. It has lasted three times longer than the other, cheaper models I have bought. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: P. Tinsley

customer_reviews.title: Durable quality machine!
customer_reviews.text: Its small but does a great job on agates! The instructions that came with it were very helpful. A normal Polish cycle takes 28 days and thia machine is built to withstand years of use.
customer_reviews.author: Adam S. Hagenston

customer_reviews.title: Well Designed Tumbler
customer_reviews.text: What a huge improvement over the original tumbler I bought that was the beginner level National Geographic. tumbler made out of plastic. Besides the holes that wore through the plastic after tumbling a few sets of rocks, the lid was difficult for me to remove and thoroughly clean when I changed grits. This new Lortone tumbler is well designed and made simple for old hands to open, remove contents and clean. Thrilled!!
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Great for small amounts at a time...
customer_reviews.text: Works great!!! Just put our second batch in for the first stage. Living on the west coast, we collect a lot of agates and they looks so nice once polished. This is a great starter tumbler for small batches. Might have to get a bigger one in the future. Will probably be from the same manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Love2fish

customer_reviews.title: Rock tumbler
customer_reviews.text: Works well but a little tough to get the lid off when using.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: We completed our first project with terrific results. The instructions provided were thorough and easy to follow. We knew just what to expect from each stage. It is really pretty quiet, too; we could hardly hear it in our garage, even with the door open. We live near the Pacific Ocean and have access to beaches with loads of agates and other stones that take a polish very well. We can hardly wait to start our next batch.
customer_reviews.author: cdrdi

customer_reviews.title: Broken and bent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived broken, bent with broken loose pieces in the box.
customer_reviews.author: Andromeda

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I did a bunch of agates with this and they turned out great.
customer_reviews.author: NWguy

customer_reviews.title: Great for sterling silver jewelry
customer_reviews.text: A professional jewler recommended this product. I put my sterling silver jewelry in it with warm water and a drop of blue Dawn detergent & run it for 30 minutes. Everything comes out sparkling! Just don’t mix metals. So easy!
customer_reviews.author: Mary M Marshburn

customer_reviews.title: Know How to Use First.
customer_reviews.text: Go to their WEB site first, before us and follow HINTS.
customer_reviews.author: Richard O'Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it to tumble the variety of rocks I've collected over the years. I've done a few batches and it works super well.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa A Pederson

customer_reviews.title: Much Better Than Plastic Hobby Store Tumblers!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy cheap plastic tumblers you may find at Toys R Us or other hobby stores. For just a little more, these professional units blow them away in terms of quality, durability and performance.
customer_reviews.author: Peter T. Szymonik

customer_reviews.title: Good!
customer_reviews.text: Works beautifully And not too loud, though we do keep it on the porch because it can get annoying to hear it constantly running. Didn't notice a huge increase on power bill either
customer_reviews.author: Brosious

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE MY TUMBLER
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE MY TUMBLER!! I'm still working out my silver coming out a little darker than I'd like but, man, it's beats the hell out of sitting and polishing everything by dremel and hand. So worth it! I used it with the jewelers mix shot.
customer_reviews.author: Cal

customer_reviews.title: poishes up my sterling silver jewelry like a gem
customer_reviews.text: Wow! poishes up my sterling silver jewelry like a gem! put 2 lbs of the SS med shot in with a few drops of dawn soap and walaa! takes away the grime, polishes it great. let it run for about an hour or so if you have heavy jewelry pieces. do not put porous stones/jewels in.
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline K. Van Ginkel

customer_reviews.title: Great for cleaning clad coins!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to clean up a large jar of clad coins that have been accumulating over the years of metal detecting. Works great when properly loaded but it gets a little warm after running for a while but nothing I am worried about. All in all, a good piece of gear.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: I love this small unit
customer_reviews.text: I have been metalsmithing for a couple of years and during that entire time - I have finished and polished my jewelry by hand or using my flexshaft. I thought I would purchase this so I wouldn't have to polish chains I make by hand. I used a burnishing liquid and used 2 lbs of mixed stainless steel shot and polished a chain. 30 minutes and it was completely polished. I love this small unit. If I only used this for chains that I make - it is well worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Casy

customer_reviews.title: A few issues - Trying again
customer_reviews.text: Ran for 24 hours than wouldn't turn anymore, Instructions are pretty poor, leaving you a lot of questions to exactly how full or not full your need the drum. Support said most likely the belt stretched which is normal so tightened it and it's working again, fingers cross for now long it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Byers

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Purchased tumbler have only used it two months, the cheap tin retainer used to hold barrel on wore out.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dog

customer_reviews.title: A Good Item to Have
customer_reviews.text: This is making a big difference in the appearance of my metal clay pieces. I postponed buying a tumbler because, well, really, who wants to buy a gizmo that just goes around and around. But I was not getting the shine on my metal clay that I really needed and finally had to say to myself, "Get a tumbler!" It does make a difference and I am glad I have it. It's very basic and it doesn't have an on-off switch, which would have been nice, but I guess a person just makes do by unplugging it.
customer_reviews.author: Montana Mackay

customer_reviews.title: We love this!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second rock tumbler I bought for my son. After just step 1 are rocks were amazing. We are stoked to keep using this.

customer_reviews.text: I use this for tumbling small metal jewelry and finished metal clay-- there are directions for that purpose included. Works great. Read the directions carefully and don't over-tighten the lid.

customer_reviews.text: Broke after less than 12 hrs. Motor is on but the 2 spin rods aren't moving so it doesn't spring the barrel
